snippet: The Institute for Supply Management said that its services index fell to 53.5 last month from 55.8 in December. The January figure was the lowest since February 2014, when it was 52.6.
abstract: Survey released by Institute for Supply Management shows service industry companies grew at slowest rate in two years in month of January, indication that global economic problems may be affecting consumer behavior; survey by ADP shows companies added 205,000 jobs in January.
lead_paragraph: The Institute for Supply Management said that its services index fell to 53.5 last month from 55.8 in December. The January figure was the lowest since February 2014, when it was 52.6.

headline.main: Service Companies’ Growth Slowed in January
headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; Service Industries Helped to Lift Jobs Numbers
